title: Valance, ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave
dimensions:
Warp: 67.5cm (26 1/2in.). Weft: 190.5cm (75in.).
Width is three pieces sewn together.
description:
Three pieces sewn together to make a shaped valance with a scalloped bottom.
Scenes of women washing, a shepherd, an old man reading to a family group and a man beating a drum while toe young males dance. 
In red on white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Valance, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-123.
